Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: andreawwt
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, owner was always there and extremely friendly and helpful. There were mosaics on all the floors, the rooms are quite spacy, but the bathrooms are very, very small. Breakfast (included) was very nice, but there's only one option, and no eggs for example.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little place-costly but great location”
Reviews.Author: empressginger
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights, and it cost a small fortune but it was a great little old place...in walking distance to the Colosseum. Beautiful rooms and building....very fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: hikeTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent - just a minute walk to the coliseum. About 5-8 min. walk to Metro. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but are furnished very nicely and are very clean and have great decor. There is wifi, but it works only in the lobby. There is no lift, so rooms on the first floor are desirable! Great breakfast in the morning - yummy croissants, bread, yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, we loved it and hope to go back...”
Reviews.Author: ribena001
Reviews.Content: Hotel is wonderfully decorated and clean. Roberto the Manager was extremely helpful and accommodating. We also stayed on the top floor with private terrace jacuzzi room and shower. Room service offered. No lifts. Great location, within walking distance to Colosseum, forum and historical sites. There are lots of great restaurants, all within walking distance. A great experience for our first trip to Rome, one day we hope to return and stay here again. Great coffees from the intimate relaxing bar area. Easy to catch a taxi, White cabs rank a short distance away and supermarket. Many thanks to Roberto and staff for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotels Come in Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: viajerafeliz53
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel specially for the price and location.Small hotel very close to the Coliseum, metro station and main attractions. Across the street was a small grocery store and around the corner we found some great places to eat. Staff was friendly and very helpful. We arrive early in the morning they stored our luggage, we came back to the hotel before check in time and they had our room ready for us. I could not have picked a better place to stay. I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast. You need to see this quaint hotel loved the mosaic tiled floors.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 512TexasTraveler
Reviews.Content: This charming boutique hotel is located in the best part of Rome, especially for those who want to spend their time walking & sightseeing! Not only did we love the location, the owner and his staff were extremely friendly & polite. The location also gave us the opportunity to walk to restaurants and night, go into the grocery store if we wanted a snack, change money around the corner, or just begin our day with one of the most magnificent sights in Rome - the Colosseum! This 140 year old home is a sight to see in itself. We had a fairly large room (for the 3 of us) and what some people might consider as a small bathroom (but there is only so much remodeling that can be done to an antique house). They are nicely decorated, clean, and have an outlet for American plugs. For those of you who need to stay connected, free Wi-Fi is available in the lobby. As you head down to the breakfast area, check out the frescoes and decor - very fitting for the location. There are so many little things to appreciate in this hotel. The continental breakfast was delicious - exactly what I expected for being in Italy, and the perfect start to the day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming hosts, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: kathleeni60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Very tastefully decorated, comfortable beds and very clean rooms and bathroom. The towels were great! ( A personal rating indicator) We had a room w/ a little outside courtyard where we read, sipped wine before dinner and chatted. All of the staff were friendly, helpful with restaurant and travel tips; very accommodating.The location a block from the Colosseum/ Forum and the metro was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever - read all the reviews before you book.”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover_9
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel Celio, tired and hot after traveling by train from northern Italy. The man at the reception desk was brusque and indifferent. He did not give us his name. Right away things did not get off to a good start. He yelled at my son for putting his backpack on the couch beside him. Fair enough, but he had to continue to berate him for having done so. After demanding two pieces of photo id, why I don't know, he suddenly became irate because there were 5 passports. He said we had only booked a room for four. I had booked all our hotels in Italy, always getting two rooms, but I had mistakenly thought I was renting a spacious quadruple family apartment which could have a cot added. He became more and more irritated because the copier wasn't working properly and he couldn't copy our passports. I explained that obviously we were wrong but could we rectify the situation by getting two rooms. He mumbled and grumbled, but said we still had to take the quad room. After much prodding he said he could give us a single for 140 euros. We agreed, however, we later checked online and found that the rate for this room, was between 96 and 120 euro. When we got into our rooms, they were swelteringly hot. The single room had a horrible mildew smell from the bathroom. The so called spacious family quad was just a normal room with 3 beds packed next to each other. We figured we would be out all day and we could handle this, however, the A/C wasn't working so we could not sleep. My wife went down to talk to them about the heat and it turns out they control it with a switch underneath their desk. I had booked this hotel because they said they had A/C. For a while it worked then it stopped. The kids couldn't sleep and the next morning we were tired and not at all rested. Unlike most of the reviews, we found the breakfast to be exactly as advertised. Nothing great, just a continental breakfast. The server, Antonella was very nice. The next night was also sweltering, with no A/C. When my wife went to talk to him, he insisted on checking out the room. Our kids were lying on the beds in only their shorts, totally lethargic. He declared it wasn't hot and then said he couldn't make the room cold enough to satisfy Canadians. Yeah, right, obviously he hasn't been to Toronto in the summer. I wanted to check the internet, he said it wasn't working. We had picked this place because it supposedly had A/C and internet. The next day my wife went to see him and told him we were leaving. He told her we couldn't. After much arguing she asked to speak to the owner. He told us that the owner, Roberto was unavailable. Then he said he was in Russia. When we continued to press, he was suddenly able to get him on the phone. We thought the guy we were dealing with was rude but he was nothing compared to Roberto. Within a minute of talking to him, he asked my wife was she really wanted, and when she said an air conditioned room, he replied, "maybe you would like me to sprinkle rose petals on the ground where you walk". My wife replied that she considered herself a nice and fair person, and as he didn't know her, his comment was unwarranted. They still insisted we couldn't leave, and then said if we did, they would charge our visa for the full four nights. We negotiated and settled reluctantly on paying for the third night in order to get out of the contract. So beware when you give them your visa, it cost us an additional 190 euros to leave but much as we hated having to pay this, it was worth it. Finally we could enjoy Rome. Out new hotel had real A/C and very pleasant staff. Roberto told my wife he couldn't care less about negative reviews as he had loyal repeat customers. Perhaps thats what keeps them going and explains why the reviews are so polarized, but why take a chance on getting terrible customer service when there are so many hotels that value your business. For the life of me, I can't understand why this hotel is not even further down the rating list. The next street over has the Hotel Lancelot and the Hotel Capo D'Africa, both would be wonderful alternatives. This location is excellent for the Colliseum and though most of the restaurants are tourist traps, there are a few gems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveller423
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome and a cruise. We stayed at Hotel Celio both before and after our cruise for a couple of nights. We thought the decor of our room and the bathroom was really nice. The hotel staff were very nice and supremely helpful. They arranged cars to and from the airport, recommended restaurants, and advised on sites to see. The breakfast were good continental breakfasts with delicious croissants, yogurt, cheese, rolls, juice, and coffee. The hotel is close to most of the ancient city sites and right around the corner from the metro station, bus stops, and a taxi stand. Our room also had a private terrace that we enjoyed immensely. The only downside is that the shower is on the small side, but this is pretty typical in European hotels and we were certainly able to shower. The size of our room was fine and the bed was heavenly which is important after walking around Rome all day. There are loads of restaurants in the neighboring streets that are very good. We really liked the Hotel Celio and would certainly stay there when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: rotherstone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great holiday at this hotel. The owner and staff were very friendly once we had made the initial effort to chat to them. Nothing was a trouble for them. The hotel is wonderfully placed to visit the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine and the Metro Station. Great small restaurants in the adjacent streets and small supermarkets should you wish to get wine or beer to consume in the hotel room. The showers are small but no different to other places we have stayed in around Europe. Breakfast is taken inside a courtyard marquee. Great place which I would recommend and would return to.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxiebabe36
Reviews.Content: A lovely stay here in 2005. The hotel was very unique with mosaic floors in the building and the bathroom of the room. The whole décor of the room was also very unique and lovely. It is a close walk to all the sights and the coliseum and plenty of restaurants nearby to try, although most seemed to close early or not open at all. The breakfast could have been better but was still pleasant. Could have been a little better but glad to have stayed. Would not go again but would recommend to anyone to try once if staying in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Phil82
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome,staying in Hotel Celio. I have to say that after booking it I checked the reviews here and I was worried about the mixed reviews that it received. In fairness apart from the size of the room which was a bit small(But what will you get in Rome for 200 Euro a night?)If you don't tend to live out of your suitcase as I do then this won't be a problem. we found everything to be great.Roberto and the staff were friendly and helpful.They were very happy to help with any query,even as bizarre as to find a Violin shop for me. Breakfast was a continental one and was perfect for me.They have wireless Internet which was great for my laptop and I.You had to be in at 1.00am but you could make arrangements to stay out later if you wished. 5 minutes walk from the local metro station and a reasonably priced taxi ride from the main tourist spots. I even got my violin. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel Celio”
Reviews.Author: TineLouise
Reviews.Content: Date: October 22, 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Shepherdstown, WV USA Just back from our 7th stay at the exquisite Hotel Celio. Roberto and his staff always make us feel very welcome, comfortable, safe, and secure. No request is ever denied and they always do their best to recommend good restaurants and things to do and see in the eternal city. The décor of the Celio never ceases to amaze me. It is tastefully decorated down to the most discriminating detail. If you travel very much across Italy, you will very much appreciate the utilization of every inch of available space in the former Roman Mansion and the fastidious renovations that have been done. The Celio is like a delicate jewel box to be appreciated for its unassuming atmosphere and its prominent location near one of the world’s most recognizable structures, the Roman Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp69
Reviews.Content: Totally overpriced hotel, you pay for the location. The rooms we had, 260 euro per night, were ridiculously small and bared no comparison to the pictures on the website. Tiny bathrooms and rude staff. Do not book if you can help it

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Roger_and_Daphne
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise for my wife for our silver wedding anniversary in March 2007. Great location!! Yes, you can see the Colleseum from the roof garden. Approx 200 metres yet far enough away not to get too much traffic noise. If only I had read the reviews here on Trip Advisor before I booked it last November! The Celio is 'compact'. Our ground floor room was rediculously small, the bathroom not much bigger than you'd expect on an aircraft! Shame, as the place has all the potential to live up to the grand facade but it sadly fails to deliver. We didn't pay budget prices, but we were there to enjoy Rome, which we definetly did, so we made the most of the place. Breakfast was just about acceptable and almost laughably served in the tiny courtyard under a gazebo. If we'd have been spending more than 2 nights there, or had other guests with us, I'd have been looking to move hotels. We have, however, been married 25 years and our sense of humour prevailed. Rome is fabulous, though I have to say we were disappointed to see so much graffiti around the place. We found a superb little wine bar/restaurant just around the corner from the Celio. Reasonably priced and superb service. If only I could remember its name. I'll get back to this post soon as I do! So, if staying at The Celio, keep an open mind, don't expect too much or plan to spend too much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Definately would not ever stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: merryo1
Reviews.Content: My first room had bugs and very noisy. The owner/staff was quite unfriendly and not at all helpful. I found the rooms (the one with out the bugs) small and the bath too small to turn around in and I am a little person. I felt unwelcome in the common area when the owner and his wife were there using the area. I was shipping my luggage back to the US and the owners' comment was " I can't be responsible for your luggage". This was after I told him Fed EX was to pick up my luggage the day I left. This is just a sample of some of the details of my stay. All in all I would pay extra to have helpful friendly service and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice furniture, shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Rome for our joint birthday's in early Jan '07. Whilst the hotel was very nicely furnished, I'd have swapped that for a more helpful staff and the ability to have a cup of tea after long sight seeing trips! There was merely a dismissive "no" when tea was requested at 8.15pm. They claim the rooms are 'spacious' - they are not, with enough room to walk around the bed and thats it ! The breakfast was very poor also. Its a shame as clearly a lot of thought has gone into selecting the antiques, decor and the location is good, - shame the staff weren't selected with the same care.

Reviews.Title: “A Service Industry??”
Reviews.Author: JD1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Celio for the duration of my time in Rome. Great hotel location with the Coliseum just a minutes walk away. The hotel decor is certainly over the top but gives the hotel a definite charm. Overall though my experience in the Celio was not a positive one. Although the rooms are clean and well kept, they are very small. The dark colours and frescoes only serve to make the rooms seem more claustrophobic. My most serious complaint about the hotel was the attitude of the staff towards guests. Despite promises about being a 'treasured guest' in the hotel welcome e-mail the acual experience felt more like I was intruding into someone's living room. The staff were consistently dismissive towards guests giving the impression that they would prefer you not to bother them with any enquiries. Looking back at my stay I could think of no reason to recommend the Celio to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Worset hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Hugh_Mac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the night before we got married and the subsequent three nights in mid October 2003. The cost at the time was €250 per night. Which I thought was excessive but it was close to everthing, Collaseum,Forum and most of all the Irish College where we got married. The hotel was pretty and looked nice. The room had large dark doors leading into a small cramped room with little room for a double bed. the room was clean but dark a window looking out onto a side of the hotel about 2 meters away. So, so much for the view it was non existenced. The bathroom was tiny so small one could hardly turn around as was the shower. i'm not a big man only 5' 10'' and 75kgs but I couldn't move. A nighmare!!. We had an adaptor for my wifes hair drier that went missing in the room when we asked about it we were told our room was very messy but it was so small we could even empty our bags. We found the front desk manager unhelpful and igorrent. The messier for breakfast consistanced of a green tent in a courtyard. Breakfast consistanced of a crossant and tea or coffee. Not great for €250 per night. We got no satification when we complained. Do your best not to stay here. We couldn't get out soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Too precious, not.”
Reviews.Author: Gardentraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too precious, and not in a good way. I booked two nights directly at the hotel and upon first viewing, it looked to be quite charming. However, we were to find out upon staying there that it is expensive for what you receive, small dark room with mildew smelling bathroom, virtually non-existant air conditioning even though they advertise that they have it, breakfast that wouldn't feed a 5 year old and rudeness beyond belief from the manager. As we had an early flight out of Rome we asked for a taxi for 6am only to find out when double checking, that the manager had requested it for 7am, which would have made us late for our flight! Save your money and stay somewhere else, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Covenient Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: triad-nc-traveler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a upscale hotel conveniently located in Rome that had a room large enough to accomodate my wife and I and our two teenaged children. The Celio had the perfect room for us......a king bed and two singles. Our hotel room, halls, lobby, were all beautifully furnished and incredibly clean. The breakfast in the courtyard was well above average. The hotel manager was very helpful in answering our questions and making suggestions. The hotel is conveniently located a block from the Colisieum on a very quiet little street with nice sidewalk cafes all around. This hotel helped give us a great Rome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: m.y.essie
Reviews.Content: We were four adults visiting Rome (in July ) for the first time and booked 2 rooms for 4 nights directly with the Celio, through e-mail . Rome was very, very hot and we were so glad we had such a great place to reurn to each day. The arrangements were made easily with prompt replies to all questions and requests. The managers were efficient and courteous and very helpful in arranging transportation from the airport, to the cruiseship port, and a last minute tour we wanted. Everything was as it appeared online and even better. The location is perfect--away from the noise of major streets --two blocks from the Colosseo and public transportation. They were pleased to make taxi or restaurant reservations for us. The property is small, quiet , private, and lovely with mosaic tile floors, decorated walls and ceilings and is very clean . People who see our pictures always comment on how elegant it appears. The rooms are small but beautfully decorated. The bathroom fixtures are new and quite nice but the space is extremely small. The tented breakfast area is lovely. After a few days, some variety in the breakfast rolls offered would have been appreciated, but the coffee and juice were quite good. There are several good restaurants within walking distance. Finding good food is not a problem in Rome. We had a wonderful time , were very happy at the Celio and are pleased to recommend it to anyone who wants a more local experience than a larger or chain hotel can offter. We are truly grateful to everyone there who helped to make our visit so wonderful and would certainly love to go back. We will remember it also if we are ever able to to visit Venice, where they have another property. We loved it. Essie

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Celio”
Reviews.Author: derrickpover
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfully delightful hotel right in the heart of the eternal City! We spent three days there in May and everything about it was just magical... Roberto and his team looked after us like we were old friends and there is an incredibly stylish charm about the place which reminds one of some of the best Venetian interiors... don't be put off by the small space.. don't forget Rome is three thousand years old and some of the most memorable sights have been carved out of available niches! The Celio is literally a stones throw away from the Colliseum surrounded by some fabulous restaurants and just a short stroll away from some of Romes most beautiful Ancient sites.. including the Forum. Staying so close you get a chance to see the ancient monuments illuminated at night which is just breathtaking! The hotel itself is beautifully designed with mosaic floors, frescoes and a roof garden to die for!... make sure you go up on the roof and be inspired!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Ken-and-Linda
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with every aspect of this chic boutique hotel. In particular, it is very clean, beautifully furnished, and well positioned for the major sights. The attention to detail in all respects is admirable but above all we were made to feel welcome at all times. The suites are worth the extra and get one on the top floor with the terrace, if you don't mind a few stairs. Many thanks to Roberto and his team. Ken & Linda Thompson, UK

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Celio a boutique bargain.”
Reviews.Author: aggiesgirl
Reviews.Content: I cannot envision a nicer place to stay in Rome than the Hotel Celio. I was reminded of New York City hotels where space is at such a premium; however, the scrumptious decor and accessories made our room a delightful haven. We even had a rooftop garden accessible through the bathroom. The staff is helpful and friendly, the breakfasts more than adequate and beautifully served on a covered patio. Laundry service was a tad expensive, but everything else here, including the rates, were a pleasant surpirse.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Hotel Celio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this beautiful hotel. The décor is elegant, with incredible attention to detail everywhere. Gorgeous mosaics. The bed in our room was large and very comfortable. Bathroom was adequate – modern and sleek - Ferragamo bath products were a nice touch. Climb the stairs to the roof terrace for lovely views; a great place to share a bottle of wine after a long day touring. Roberto and the staff couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful with plenty of good recommendations for restaurants and things to see. The continental breakfast was quite standard – I’m not sure what other guests were expecting. The breakfast area is situated in the courtyard under a wonderful canopy – well protected, even in the rain! This small hotel’s location is fantastic. The Coliseum is two blocks away. Metro stop is a quick 10 minute walk, and bus stops even closer. The small grocery store on the corner sells delicious cheese, and there is a nice fruit/veg stand a block down the street. Good restaurants and wine bars all within a couple of blocks. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Payed for the location”
Reviews.Author: Paultje1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. We were lucky to have a room (the smallest) for this hotel is mostly fully booked. Is it therefore we got a bit of a cool reception and the manager ignored us ? On the other hand, we could leave our luggage on our departureday at the reception to pick it up in the afternoon, which is nice. Breakfast is without inspiration and has a very slow service. Lucky for us we could pick some breakfastitems from people who already left otherwise we would have to leave table still hungry, therefore we took breakfast outside the hotel. The room is small, a bit noisy but has an excellent bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be insulted, waste money and see how not to treat customers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you find you just have too much money as you vaction thru Europe then stay at this hotel. They charge so much for everything you'll soon find your money going. If you find you just are not getting insulted and treated badly enough in your home life then this is also the place for you. The staff seemed to do everything with such bad manners its almost (almost) funny to watch. I think I saw staff smile at the folks who stay in the big rooms or apartments, but nothing but disgust and contempt was shown to our family. Also, if you are planning on decreasing your height any time soon then this place would be perfect. The shower in our room was clearly only designed for very very small adults or children. Breakfast - forget about it. We saw a line of people to get one of the few tables every morning, but they shouldnt have bothered, the food portion was also only ok for a child, and the service was appaling.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else - somewhere you are wanted !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it was like we were just in the way all the time for the staff and management. they acted like if unimportant people like us (in the small rooms) just were not there they could concentrate on their preferred clients (who presumably were in the larger rooms?). we coulnt really unpack all our cases etc because the room was so small. after one forray into the totally basic breakfast area (and food) we decided to breakfast elsewhere every day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, gentle and well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked very much this hotel. It is small but the room I've stayed is big, very beautiful, clean. It is well located (near from colosseo and restaurants, turistic bus point, metro etc). The manager was simpathic and there was good and free internet, what is not common. There is video (VHS) to locate, but it was expensive (R$ 5,00). I didn't eat the breakfest. The decoration by "mosaicos" is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I, plus our teenage son stayed for 4 nights to celebrate my 50th Birthday and we couldn't have picked a better Hotel. the decor is fantastic not your usual bland boring Hotel rooms, position is excellent. Roberto, his wife and staff were very welcoming, and they give the Hotel such a warm feeling after a hard day walking round Rome you are so pleased to be back. make sure you get up to the roof terrace wonderful views and so quiet. Rome is an amazing place and apart from the obvious must sees, its great just to sit in a square drink a coffee and watch the world go by. Don' t miss walking round the Jewish Quarter fascinating. Don't go to the Hotel Celio if you like standard hotels with all the usual amenities, however if you want somewhere with character and owners who care about there guests this is the Hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not pet friendly, no restaurant, average breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not pet friendly, no restaurant, meagre breakfast !!

Reviews.Title: “Great central retreat”
Reviews.Author: Acer sed justus
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer said, this is not your cookie-cutter sort of hotel, but if you're looking for a place with quiet, character and a central location, I doubt you'd do very much better. My visit was a one-nighter en famille: it was fine for that, but it would probaby be even better for a romantic/older party.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Celio, from 3 - 9 May, for our 2nd Wedding Anniversary. As my wife is disabled I contacted the hotel beforehand and received a prompt reply from the Hotel Manager, Roberto. He was very helpful and upon our arrival assisted in every way. The Hotel is in an excellent location in the ancient part of Rome. From the reception, and throughout the small hotel, the decor and ambience is wonderful. The room was luxurious, with an excellent view of the Colosseum (see photos). The service was impeccable. The rooms were clean and very well presented, with fresh towels daily. Roberto and his staff were very helpful. Roberto has an excellent command of English and although the other staff could speak some English, being able to speak some Italian helped break the language barrier. The Staff even helped me try to get tickets to a concert at the Vatican, which I had been trying to get. They also recommended some places to visit and eat and these turned out to be good recommendations. Locally, the best place to eat was the 'Triclinium Ristorante' which was just around the corner from the Hotel Celio, on the via di Giovanni Laterano. We went there every morning for Coffee and to try our Italian on the locals. It was (is) poor but they appreciated it. So much so that one morning we found that our bill had been paid by a lady we had been talking too, Thank-you Suzanne! We also ate there a couple of evenings; their pizzas were quintessentially Italian, wonderful! To be honest I would avoid some of the other restaurants in the area, being close to the Colosseum is not an excuse for poor food quality. Rome is an incredible place, a chaotic fusion of Ancient, Renaissance and modern Italian life, which happens to work well. I would forget public transport and walk everywhere, there is so much to see in the back streets and behind the scenes. We found some lovely streets and Piazzas. Hotel Celio is a romantic and excellent place to stay in Rome. Thank you to Roberto & Nadine, for making our stay as easy and as wonderful as possible. According to legend as we threw a coin into the Trevi Fountain, we are sure to return to Rome. When we do we certainly will be stopping at the Hotel Celio.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and felt very well at the small and very beautiful hotel. We had booked a superior double room and were lucky to get one half of the suite at the beautiful roof garden. The room was very nice and clean, the roof garden was very romantic, on 2 nights in the weekend they ignited candles for us. The view from the roof garden was great, we had a straight look the the colloseum. The service at the reception and at breakfast was very friendly. The interior of the hotel is full of lovely details. We highly recommend this hotel for people who prefer small lovely hotels. Another advantage is the very central location of the hotel, the colloseum is only 200m to got. We had a great week an Rome and rate Hotel Celio as an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPPOINTING: VERY POOR SERVICE AND ATMOSPHERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small and dark. You should bring a torch/candles if you intend staying ! The curtains were oversized and dusty (as was whole room) and the window shutters hardly opened. The toilet was tiny. I dont know how anyone could possibly turn around in the shower. The toilet had no visable or audible ventilation. The toilet door opened up right onto the side of the double bed. Breakfast was another big negative. Food was very basic, served with zero customer service, in a small tent in an enclosed airless courtyard, beside loud Air Con units (which buzzed all night long). The reception area is also very dark, and is given a generally unwelcoming feel by the staff. Of the 3 staff we encountered; only 1 spoke english well. I guess that didnt really matter as none of them seemed that bothered to provide anything approaching a quality customer service, or to be friendly. In general, our impression was the hotel is trying to portray a pseudo olde worlde or artistic image, but the approach to delivering this image is bizzare - keeping the whole place as dark and dusty and gloomily functional as possible. As the room was expensive, the whole experience was a major let down. We found ourselves walking around Rome trying to find anything to do - just to limit our time in the gloomy hotel. The only positive we found was that the location is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Hotel Celio. The location is ideal - just a couple of minutes from the Coliseum, with a taxi stand and metro station nearby. The room was good sized, modern bathroom, quality furnishings. Our room was in the back and was fairly quiet. Staff was most pleasant and helpful. They made advance dinner reservations for us at top restaurants before we arrived. The mosaic floors are spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Celio Hotel was a perfect place for us to stay. We made the arrangements without a travel agent because the manager responded quickly with all the information. The price was reasonable and the location is perfect because we could walk to the ancient sites and take an inexpensive taxi ride to others. The walk past the lighted Colosseum back to the hotel each evening is unforgettable. The hotel is very secure which is very important to us. It is beautifully decorated with mosaics and fresco art and has all the modern amenities-- we felt like we were in an Italian villa rather than an ordinary hotel. Our room was a good size (for four of us!) and the bathroom was very nice. Best of all is the staff -- Roberto (the manager) personally helped us with directions, taxis, which sites to see, times to go, and even gently helped us with Italian words. His wife Nadia and the staff are very nice and provided the best (but not intrusive) service including a really nice breakfast and daily room cleaning. We, including our 10 and 14 year old daughters, haven't stopped talking about the Hotel Celio since we left Rome!!! We will stay there again when we return to Rome. Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Small and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Del2n
Reviews.Content: The Celio is only a stone's throw from the Collosseum. The rooms are small but beautifully furnished. Our host Roberto was a bit quiet when we first arrived, but after I tried a few words of Italian, I think he warmed to us. Just learn a few words of the language and see the difference it makes. We will definately be back. Try the local restaurants - cheaper than in the centre and better atmosphere and food. A hint: If you want to visit the Collosseum, avoid the queues by visiting the Palatine Hill - entrance near Collosseum and lots more to see - early in the day to avoid the crowds. The ticket, 11 euros, also gives entrance to the Collosseum. So, spend the day touring the hill and late afternoon, walk past the crowds and straight into the Collosseum. As for Rome: as Audrey Hepburn says in Roman Holiday, "Rome is Rome".

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 18 March 2006 Visitor Tyne and Wear It is often a risk when booking hotels no matter what the description when obtaining information from the Internet. The location turned out to be better than expected as the hotel was very close to the Colisseum and the standard/quality of decoration and furniture was quite exceptional. The atmosphere was very calm and relaxing and the staff helpful but stayed in the background. Roberto was charming both when corresponding by e-mail and in person. The roof garden was a nice addition. Breakfast was in a quaint small marquee in the central courtyard. The continental breakfast was always the same and simple but nice. The slight downside was that the rooms and paticularily the ensuites were small. Very close by was a very good restaurant called Paradiso. Our party would certainly book the Hotel Celio if we visited Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I expected a pleasant experience when we arrived at what appeared to be a charming place to stay. SMALL is the operative word. We heard nothing about a rooftop terrace, nor a "spacious" room with a jacuzzi. Roberto was the epitome of rude, and seemed to resent our presence. He had arranged for a driver to meet us at a location near the airport who would then take us on a tour. We waited for approximately 45 minutes. The driver said that he had been told to wait for a call. We were charged for the time by Roberto. I will never stay there again and would recommend that others do likewise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the hotel celio and it was made all the more special by the superb hospitality. The location is ideal as it is only a few 100 metres away from the colosseo. The rooms are exquisitely furnished and although the bathroom is a bit small it is well equiped even with a mosaic floor! I would not hesitate in reccomending this hotel and I will be certainly returning to the celio some time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Charm,Warmth and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: oscar435
Reviews.Content: When I return to Rome, this is where I'll stay. Quiet neighborhood, great location and above all, a charming and helpful staff lead by Roberto, the propietor. There are bigger, more glamorous and luxurious hotels in Rome,of course, but I would stay here and consider myself lucky to have found such a treasure. This hotel is a refuge from the madness of crowds. The terrific restaurants in the area make this choice ideal after roaming the streets of Rome all day for a quiet night in the most beautiful city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel just right behind the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In 2005 I stayed three different times at the Hotel Celio: in june, november and december. And I will come back again because everything was totally to my satisfaction. I loved especially the charming way they furnitured every single room with different pieces and paintings. The whole hotel gives you the impression to stay in a small but fine palazzo. Every room has got the name of a different famous italian painter and reflects the fact of its individual style. I find Roberto and his team very helpful. Breakfast is served in the courtyard in a nice dent, a perfect start for your trip and walks through Rome. The location is outstanding, just a few meters behind the Colosseum, in a very silent sidestreet. Around the hotel - towards the Church of San Clemente (3 min) you will find wunderful places to eat ... and enjoy real roman food and atmosphere ... Strongly recommend this place to everybody who would like to spend a couple of nice days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless host”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the location of the Celio Hotel - a 100 yards for the collosseum - is as good as one might want in Rome, and although there are fine restaurants on the doorstep, I however would not recommend this hotel to anybody and will certainly never return. Sure enough, it was comfortable and clean and decorated to a certain taste, etc. but as for customer service - forget about it. The main protagonist - I am guessing the proprietor - could not have been less helpful. The general demeanour and attitude of the few staff (but especially of this individual with the proprietorial air) was indifferent and condescending almost to the point of rudeness. If he is not the proprietor, then I would advise that the real owner get rid of him. If he is, then hopefully none of customers will ever return - as this customer never will. Apart from the utterly charmless staff, I also have a few more bones to pick:- the bathrooms (I happened to see 3 of them) were of small cupboard size where one cannot swing a cat, and the toilet bowl was rendered virtually unusable in one of these bathrooms, stuck between the cupboard walls as it was; the miserable breakfast with luke warm coffee served in the courtyard tent is really below par for any other hotels in this price range (mid-range to expensive); the additional €12 charge for delivering this inadequate snack at the room and the exorbitant charges for a coffee at the reception all smacked of opportunism by a thoroughly charmless host. Surely any one of the other hotels in this area would be preferable. We will not be returning to the Celio.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: winchcombe1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned froma short break in Rome made all the more special by our stay at the Hotel Celio. Great location , close to the Colosseum, but tucked away in a quiet street with good local restaurants nearby. We were lucky enough to stay in the Pompeian Suite, jacuzzi bath and modern facilities - biggest bonus was the rooftop terrace, great views during the day and at night after a hard days sightseeing we could climb the stairs with a bottle of wine and watch Rome by night - magical. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated room in a small palazzo near the Colosseum. The perfect place for a romantic weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Be pampered at the Celio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Celio Hotel was fantastic. The superbly renovated and decorated hotel displayed all the charm and character of Rome. It is perfect for a romantic interlude in Rome. The staff, especially Roberto the owner was always there and very helpful. The rooms were spacious and luxurious. The one downfall was the very small bathroom. The shower was so small, when I dropped the soap I could not pick it up without opening the shower door. However this did not distract from a superb stay. Breakfast was amazing. It was served in a fancy tent in the centre of the building. There were also good resturaunts nearby for evening meals and it is just 5 minutes from the Colloseum and close to the underground railway station. I will definitely stay there again next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pownkat
Reviews.Content: This was the most comfortable hotel we stayed in during our time in Italy. The rooms were large and beautifully furnished. The location was wonderful -- just a few blocks from the Coliseum, near many good restaurants. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Celio-A classic italian boutique hotel with Class”
Reviews.Author: Deadheadexec
Reviews.Content: On our way back from a trip to Sardinia ,we were looking to stay in a hotel that would give us the feeling we were in Italy not another chain hotel we stayed in the Ambassador Suite . With a view of the Colliseum from the windows of our room,this hotel is set in a residential street where you can observe the everyday going ons of the families around. Stayed one night and two days at Hotel Celio. Th suite was filled with amenities, spacious and comfortable. A bit noisy at night if you sleep with the windows open as there are a few clubs on other streets and you get the scooter traffic through. Large beautiful windows in this suite. Bed is actually 2 twins put together which is very common in europe. Very comfortable mattress, linens and plenty of towels. Modern shower stall with body jets above whirlpool tub which worked wonderfully. Lots of closet space and a safe. Location was perfect for touring ruins and colliseum. Several excellant restaurants within one block walk. Breakfast was elegantly served in an outside tent which was lavishly decorated. Consisted of breads, jams, juice and coffee. I would prefer a heavier choice of breakfast. Server was quiet and reserved but professional. Roberto was friendly and helpful when asked for suggestions and information. He made the room available for us upon arrival, which was hours before check in. He arranged the driver to pick up and return back to Rome airport. We plan to visit again and are finished searching for an Italian hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Celio is conveniently located within walking distance of the beautiful Colliseum and the Forum. It has restaurants, subway, and shops nearby. The rooms were very well decorated & comfortable. The staff was very accomodating and offered assistance in transportation and dining suggestions. I would definitely stay there again Renee

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: lucisami
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel or ever go back to it—the management treated us very rudely. Although it is decorated nicely, the rooms are unbelievably small and too dark to read in, you can’t even raise your arms in the shower, and worst of all, the attitude of the staff is haughty and condescending. They have put all their money into expensive décor and well-heeled brochures, but don’t be fooled. The money would have been better spent on learning good customer service and providing a decent continental breakfast. We asked where the thermostat was and were told that we didn’t need one because the “temperature is perfect all through the hotel.” Later (it was so cold) we asked for a blanket and after first telling us we should have asked in the morning because he didn’t know where to find them and that the bed covers were very expensive, he eventually brought a pillow to our door. There are no blankets on the beds--you have to use the "expensive" spread. When we questioned whether he understood what we were asking for, he became loud and rude and stated that he understood all the English he wanted to understand. All the other hotels we stayed in on this three week trip throughout Italy were pleasant and accommodating—but not Hotel Celio. When they called a taxi for us, the fare was always 5 euros more than when we walked out the door and got our own. And the breakfast was only rolls and coffee—no cheese, no prosciutto, no fruit! We were never told about the Internet access, but noticed the Italien guests using it. The hotel is all show and very cold. A very unpleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fabulous boutique style hotel with friendly service and tastefully decorated rooms then look no further! We had a fabulous two days here were everything from the warm croissants served in the quirky little dining room, to catching the last rays of sunshine on the roof terrace were just perfect. Not to mention being just seconds from all the attractions of ancient Rome with a choice of restaurants on your doorstep. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Celio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in this beautiful hotel. Wonderful service, very clean, good location and had wonderful character. Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Ciampino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the Celio as part of a quick tour of Italy. The Celio is perfectly located near Ciampino Airport which we were using, straight run in to Roma along Via Appia, good instructions issued by hotel with map to find it. Located five minutes walk from the Colesseum on a quiet street this was the perfect base for a whistle stop tour. The hotel is very tastefully deorated and we found it to be spotlessly clean. The room we had was small but beautifully deorated with a great eye for detail. The bathroom was also small but had every modern convenience and was also deorated with some panache. With a roof garden and a discreet host we will definitely be back. This is the perfect hotel if you wish to avoid the larger impersonal chains around Rome. I would definitely recommend it for a romantic break, we loved the red theme in our room and the tiled mosaic floor, sadly our schedule only gave us a glimpse of a hodden gem.

Reviews.Title: “As always love the Celio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome and stayed in the Hotel Celio, this was our third visit to Rome and our third stay in the Celio. As before the small but luxurious room was very clean and well decorated. The staff were helpful and pleasant and you really cant beat this hotel for its wonderful location near the Colloseum and the Forum. Beware the restaurants opposite the Colloseum - the view may be fantastic but the quality and prices are extremely poor and was our only low point of a wonderful holiday to the Eternal City. Even the crowds and heat of August could not put us off a trip to this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed 4 nights at the Celio Hotel and really enjoyed it. The hotel is attractive, clean, quiet and very conveniently located - only a few blocks from the Coliseum. We had a triple room, which was a good size, not too small, and a terrace that we enjoyed very much. Good restaurants are nearby and breakfast served at the Celio each morning was pleasant. A real convenience was the WiFi service that we accessed from our room and terrace. We would definitely stay at the Celio again.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of Italian hospita;lity - not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ridiculously expensive for what you get. The rooms are small/pokey, the breakfast just about acceptable and the staff just plain rude. The decor is clever, but in the end it is a triumph of style over quality. You're not welcome in public areas and frankly there are moments when you feel they can't wait to get rid of you. Whilst the hotel is expensive, it behaves in a cheap way - when I went to pay my bill they said they'd prefer me to pay by Mastercard rather than Amex (presumably because the pay a smaller commission to Mastercard). How cheap is that? They treated leaving your bags on the premises after checking out as a piece of generosity - have you ever known a decent hotel refuse? When I asked for a room to wash in before we headed off to the airport I thought I'd asked for a week in the bridal suite. Do not go there, unless you're keen to be made a fool of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance, but lacking overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Celio during the last week in May and found it be beautifully restored and richly appointed, but, given the cost and the ratings, we were surprised at what our room and the staff actually had (or didn't have) to offer. Our clean, overly a/c'd and badly lit first floor room, "overlooked" the tented courtyard and we were awakened each morning at the crack of dawn during the breakfast setup. The bathroom was really small, but the shower was so ridiculously small that you could not raise your arms to shampoo or bend to pick up dropped soap. The staff (the same 2 gentlemen every day, regardless of hour) were not particularly friendly or helpful. These deficiencies did not become apparent to us until we checked into other small hotels throughout Italy that were equally charming and conveniently located, but offered much more, and where you were actually made to feel welcome and valued as a guest. I guess the guests in the more expensive upper floor rooms had a totally different expeience, which is not the way to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just took a trip through Europe and this was probably our least favorite spot. The ambiance (decor, mosaics, fabrics) was nice...and we enjoyed a trip around Rome that we organized through the hotel with a driver. However, the front desk personnel were alternately friendly and grumpy. Comments were made about our Internet use when we stayed in the front area during a rainy day. It seems like the use of the public spaces made them uncomfortable. And finally, our room was very small. The place was clean and all right...and it was definitely in a great location next to the Colisseum....with a wonderful restaurant kitty-korner across the street. Overall, however, it was not our best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite the high ranking of Hotel Celio in tripadvisor and Lonely Planet guide, our personal experiences of this hotel recently have been dire! The bathroom was so small my partner could not physically towel off after a shower !! The bedroom was pokey and dark. Breakfasts were basic, yoghurt and a croissant + coffee/tea in comparison with other equally priced hotels in Rome. The worst example came from the owner Roberto who was rude, unhelpful and keen to overcharge us at every event, lacking integrity and with no idea of hospitality or excellence in service levels - I can't honestly believe he is allowed to run this establishment and the Italian Tourist Board should investigate his practices!! If looking for a hotel in Rome, I'd suggest the Radisson SAS which at roughly the same prices as Celio is charging and three times the room size + great service it's superb in comparison! Celio was a huge disappointment despite paying over £3,000 for our stay there - my advise, go to the Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: supercyc
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel, everything is kept incredibly clean. Although the rooms are a little small and the shower is about the size of a space capsule, the fantastic service, great location just a few hundred meters from the colleseum, and good continental breakfast more than made up for it. The owner was also incredible nice and easy to talk to. A heartwarming and cozy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a huge amount of time researching hotels in Rome, we stayed here for a romantic long weekend in June 2005 and loved it. As a three star hotel, the place lacks some of the services and large-scale facilities (e.g. restaurants, bars, conference facilities) found in higher class hotels, but more than makes up for it with an abundance of unique charm and character. We stayed in the Pompeian Suite on the top floor, which although pricey was absolutely beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The attention to detail in the floor and bathroom mosaics was lovely, and the room is also decorated with renaissance style paintings and canvasses. Our room had a separate lounge and two bathrooms which were both spacious. There was also a well-stocked mini bar (not too over the top price-wise). The suite also has three private roof terraces - one of which has a view of the Colliseum, and we loved coming back to sunbathe, chill out and enjoy a drink after a day's sight-seeing. There is also a public roof terrace for anyone staying at the hotel. There were quite a lot of stairs to walk up to our room, which could be a problem for some people, but the other rooms are located on the ground and first floors. The included continental breakfast is adequate but nothing special, served in a covered courtyard. We found the staff to be helpful and polite at all times. The location is ideal for exploring ancient Rome (Coliseum, Fora, Palatine Hill etc), but is otherwise a little further away from other tourist areas such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navonna etc. Personally we found it an advantage to be located away from the crowds in the Centro Storico, and nowhere was more than a 25 minute walk or so at the most. There are also quite a lot of nice non-touristy restaurants, bars and cafes within a few blocks of the hotel, as well as a supermarket and grocery store opposite. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Celio as a lovely memorable place to stay. The photos on the hotel's website give an accurate impression of what the place is like.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the the Hotel Celio for a week and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is beautifully decorated with mosaic floors throughout. The location could not be better. Situated on a quite street a few short blocks from the Colosseum and the Forum, it is literally minutes away from many of the best ancient sites in Rome. It is also convenient to a number of wonderful neighborhood restaurants, some overlooking the Colosseum. My family stayed in the beautiful Ambassador Suite which combined a rich historic feel with the most modern of conveniences. The bathroom was large with a jacuzzi bath. It was always a treat to return to the room at the end of the day. The owner, Roberto, and his staff made our stay even more special. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. His correspondence was immediate before the trip and once there, he did everything he could to make our trip enjoyable. We would never stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel with small but elagant rooms, each with a feel of style and comfort. The location a perfect distance to walk to fantastic resturants and a fantastic view of the Colosseum. The service was friendly and helpful in all our needs and questions. We really enjoyed the little breakfast that was there for us each morning before we ventured out to the sights of Rome. A great find!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't like writing reviews..but ok Roberto..this is my honest opinion. Hotel Celio is in a stylish building in a quiet street with a discreet side entrance. The feel is 'club' and boutique. The location has lots of 'local' interest despite being so close to the Colosseum with some excellent and lively trattorias nearby. It is a long walk from the centro historico but this was probably a good thing considering the amount of pizza we were eating! The famous mosaic tiling is indeed beautiful although often hidden in dim light. The room was charming and very clean but extremely cramped, save for the very high ceiling. The bed was very hard but flat and much better than a lumpy old sprung mattress. Carting suitcases up and down the stairs was tough. The service was polite and efficient, but lacked warmth and enthusiasm. But overall a well run, quality hotel in an amazing and wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in Rome. Value for money. The room is not that spacious but with a great decoration and really comfortable. The jacuzzi inside the room gave an extra credit to this hotel. The location is strategic especially if you travel with the Metro. Plus, it is very close to the Colleseum! Advantage for those who want to make a walking tour to the rest of the city. The crew speak good English as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent recommended Hotel 5/5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from the 10th of June until the 13th of june. It is a lovely little romantic hotel with an excellent location. Only 2 blocks away from the Colloseum. The service is excellent and although the rooms where not that big they had everything you need (including minibar and valuable airconditioning) We heard some bad stories about Italian hotels so we used Tripadvisor to find a hotel which meet our standards. Hotel Celio won't dissappoint you. The service is excellent, the location is perfect, the rooms are small but very clean and look fantastic& breakfast was sufficient. The location of the hotel is great. It is in a small side street behind the Colloseum so you don't have any noise of cars and tourists. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area and everything in Rome is in walking distrance. The Vatican is 30 minutes walk, the station is 25 minutes and all the other main attractions are within minutes. Even for non-walkers like myself and my wife it was easy to do so. Roberto, the General Manager, is very helpful and helped us booking a taxi back to the airport, managed our luggage on arrival when the rooms were not ready yet and even took care of our possesions when the room was being cleaned and we wanted to drop some souvenier shopping off. All in all it is a great hotel which I can definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two evenings recently. The hotel is small and very charming. It's evident that Roberto (the proprietor) takes great pride in his hotel and has put forth much effort. Our room was small (not a surprise in Rome), but clean and tastefully decorated. Our bathroom was VERY small but we were fortunate to have a door in the bathroom that opened onto a rooftop patio, so it made it seem a bit bigger. You absolutely can't beat the location! It's literally around the corner from the Coliseum, but it's away from a crowded street. Breakfast was simple, but good, and served outdoors under a tent. Roberto deserves a special tip of the hat for helping us with the parking garage after we misplaced our ticket!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Celio!”
Reviews.Author: familyfun999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the ancient section of Rome. When you walk out of the hotel each day, you look down the street at the Coloseum. That, and the Roman Forum are both just a couple of blocks away from the hotel. The hotel is tranquil but just a short walk to the activity. We spent eight nights in Rome at the Hotel Celio with our two teenage sons. We had a room with one King and two twin beds. The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated with fabric wallcoverings and artistic mosaic floor tiles in the bath and common areas. The place was not only lovely to look at, but also immaculately clean. Our host, Roberto and his staff, took good care of us and his care of the hotel really shows, as well. There were flower boxes in the windows, and ivy and vines along the driveway. There is a large roof top garden/patio, but we were out sightseeing so much that we didn't get a chance to enjoy that. If we get back to Rome, we will definately go back to the Hotel Celio. I am already recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome has everything you need for the romantic holiday and Hotel Celio provides the icing on the cake. The place is unique with maticulous attention to detail. The roof garden is a perfect hideaway after a long day of sight seeing with gorgeous views across the roof tops. Roberto and his team ensure that you have privacy but will give you advice and help if you require it. We will be coming back but perhaps next time to visit thier sister hotel in Venice for our anniversary! Sam & Sandy, Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “Okay!!”
Reviews.Author: Contessa
Reviews.Content: A good effort at something different but we didn't care for the location close to the Colosseum. The Centro Storico makes a much nicer base. It's also a little expensive and a little lacking in atmosphere but the tiny bathroom was excellent and we were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel truely is a masterpiece. The location is great and the staff at the hotel were always extremely helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Celio Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Santissimi Quattro 35/c, 00184 Rome, Italy
